thread.title: Eugenie Bouchard holds up her end of Super Bowl date bet | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Eugenie Bouchard holds up her end of Super Bowl date bet | Daily Mail Online

author: Oliver Todd For Mailonline
title: Eugenie Bouchard holds up her end of Super Bowl date bet | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Eugenie Bouchard has paid out on her end of her Super Bowl bet. Back on the night of February 5, the Canadian tennis star was confident enough of Atlanta Falcons win that she agreed to date a fan if the result went the other way. Of course, the New England Patriots' sporting miracle followed. And on Wednesday night, Bouchard followed up the bet after posing for Sports Illustrated's Swimsuit issue. Scroll down for video Eugenie Bouchard and her blind date John Goehrke take their seats at a basketball game They had courtside seats to the game between the Brooklyn Nets and Milwaukee Bucks Bouchard had earlier revealed she was on her way to meet her Super Bowl date with this snap Bouchard then posed alongside her Twitter date John Goehrke on their way to the game Bouchard agreed to date a fan if the New England Patriots won the Super Bowl - and they did 'Busy day with @si_swimsuit and then tonight... I'm going on a date,' the world's No 44-ranked player posted on Twitter, alongside a winking emoji. And after another fan retweeted the image of Bouchard in a car with a message suggesting it was 'date night' for the Patriots-backing punter John Goehrke, he 'liked' the tweet. Later on in the evening, she added another photo to her Twitter account, captioning it: 'Just met my 'Super Bowl Twitter Date' John. On our way to the @BrooklynNets game! @punslayintwoods'. Bouchard and Goehrke realise that their image is on the large screen in the stadium They then both give a big smile as onlookers nearby also notice the couple on the big screen Bouchard looked to be enjoying herself throwing a shirt out into the crowd during the game The pair headed to a basketball game between the Brooklyn Nets and Milwaukee Bucks on Wednesday night, with courtside seats. While the pair looked a little awkward together in some photographs they were able to give a big smile when they realised their image was being shown on the big screen. And Bouchard got into the swing of things during the game by throwing a shirt out into the crowd. And afterwards Goehrke said in the video that Bouchard posted that it been the 'best date ever'. The pair take their seats during the first half of the match at the Barclays Centre, Brooklyn Bouchard filmed a short video of her and her date which she posted to Instagram later Bouchard gave a thumbs up as her partner described it as 'the best date ever' Despite looking a little uncomfortable in the video, John Goehrke seemed to have a good time
